critique: This document establishes rules for the classified service of the Government Printing Office. It outlines the classification of employees based on salary, examination procedures for admission, and processes for appointment, promotion, transfer, and reinstatement. There is a slight tilt towards economic regulation as it sets up a classification system based on salary. There is also a slight tilt towards social inclusion as it allows both men and women to be examined for positions. The document does not seem to have a strong stance on immigration, executive power, federalism, or national security vs. civil liberties.
